debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Good evening and welcome, the Democratic presidential primary here in South Carolina. The first primary in the South is just four days away.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: And Super Tuesday is just a week away and this is the biggest primary day of the year as voters in 14 states cast ballots and many of them tell us they have not actually made up their mind. So this debate when you think about it tonight may be the last best chance for the candidates to make their case to South Carolina and Super Tuesday voters.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: And CBS News is proud to bring you this debate along with our co-sponsors. They are the Democratic National Committee and the Congressional Black Caucus Institute, a nonpartisan organization committed to educating voters and training political leaders.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: And we are partnering tonight also with Twitter. So you at home can participate in this debate. How do you do that? Send us your questions for the candidates using the Twitter hashtag, DemDebate.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Now, here are the rules for the next two hours. When you were asked a question, you will have one minute and 15 seconds to answer and 45 seconds for followups. So let’s begin. Senator Sanders, we haven’t had a national unemployment rate this low for this long in 50 years. Here in South Carolina, the unemployment rate is even lower. How will you convince voters that a democratic socialist can do better than President Trump with the economy?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Well, you’re right, the economy is doing really great for people like Mr. Bloomberg and other billionaires. In the last three years, last three years, billionaires in this country saw an $850 billion increase in their wealth. But you know what, for the ordinary American things are not so good. Last year, real wage increases for the average worker were less than one percent. Half of our people are living paycheck to paycheck. 87 million Americans have no health insurance or are under-insured. 45 million people are struggling with student debt. 500,000 people tonight are sleeping out on the street, including 30,000 veterans. That is not an economy that’s working for the American people. That’s an economy working for the one percent. We’re going to create an economy for all, not just wealthy campaign contributors.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Senator-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Mayor Bloomberg, I’ll let you respond to that. Do you think Senator Sanders’ economy would be better for America than President Trump?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: I think that Donald Trump thinks it would be better if he’s president. I do not think so. Vladimir Putin thinks that Donald Trump should be President of the United States. And that’s why Russia is helping you get elected so you lose to him.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Oh, Mr. Bloomberg. Let me tell Mr. Putin. Okay, I’m not a good friend of President Xi of China. I think President Xi is an authoritarian leader. And let me tell Mr. Putin who interfered in the 2016 election, try to bring Americans against Americans. Hey, Mr. Putin, if I’m President of the United States, trust me you’re not going to interfere in anymore American elections.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Warren.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: We know what the President … what Russia wants, it’s chaos.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Look, the way I see this is that Bernie is winning right now because the Democratic Party is a progressive party and progressive ideas are popular ideas. Even if there are a lot of people on this stage who don’t want to say so. But Bernie and I agree on a lot of things, but I think I would make a better president than Bernie. And the reason for that is that getting a progressive agenda enacted is going to be really hard and it’s going to take someone who digs into the details to make it happen. Bernie and I both wanted to help reign in Wall Street. In 2008, we both got our chance, but I dug in, I fought the big banks, I built the coalitions and I won. Bernie and I both want to see universal healthcare, but Bernie’s plan doesn’t explain how to get there, doesn’t show how we’re going to get enough allies into it and doesn’t show enough about how we’re going to pay for it.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: I dug in, I did the work and then Bernie’s team trashed me for it. We need a president who is going to dig in, do the hard work and actually get it done. Progressive’s have got one shot and we need to spend it with a leader who will get something done.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Mayor Buttigieg, we want to bring you in his conversation. Why would the Russians to be working on behalf of Bernie Sanders?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: I’ll tell you what the Russians want. They don’t have a political party. They want chaos and chaos is what is coming our way. I mean, look, if you think the last four years has been chaotic, divisive, toxic, exhausting, imagine spending the better part of 2020 with Bernie Sanders versus Donald Trump. Think about what that will be like for this country. And meanwhile, folks at home from South Carolina to South Bend are trying to figure out what any of this means for us. Because it’s right that there is a progressive majority, an American majority that wants to see real change, wants to see wages go up and go up faster than the cost of health and saving for retirement. But also there’s the majority of the American people who I think right now just to be able to turn on the TV, see their President and actually feel their blood pressure go down a little bit instead of up through the roof. We have an opportunity to set a different tone.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Mr. Steyer.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Bernie Sanders’ analysis is right. The difference is I don’t like his solutions. I don’t believe that a government takeover of large parts of the economy makes any sense for working people or for families. I think that what we need to do is to present an alternative that includes a vibrant competitive private sector, but we all know unchecked capitalism has failed. The answer’s not for the government to take over the private sector though. The answer is for us to break the corporate stranglehold on our government and have the government work for the people again.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Vice President Biden.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Well, let me just finish because we need to have an alternative to Donald Trump. I’m talking about doubling the minimum wage, cutting taxes by 10% for everybody who makes less than $250,000 and creating over four and a half million good paying union jobs. Donald Trump stinks. He’s incompetent. As a steward of the American economy, we have to show that we can create a growing prosperous economy [crosstalk 00:07:13] that works for American working people.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Mr. Steyer, thank you, your time’s up. Vice President Biden.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: We talk about progressive, let’s talk about being progressive. Walking distance here is Mother Emanuel Church. Nine people shot dead by a white supremacist. Bernie voted five times against the Brady Bill and monitored a waiting period … No, let me finish. A waiting period of 12 hours. I’m not saying he’s responsible for the nine deaths, but that man would not have been able to get that weapon with the waiting period had been what I suggest until you are cleared. In addition to that, being progressive, he thought Barack Obama, he wanted a primary. He said we should primary Barack Obama, someone should. And in fact the president was weak and our administration was in fact not up to it. Look, folks, let’s talk about progressive. Progressive is getting things done. And that’s what we got done. We got a lot done.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Senator Sanders, your response.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Pete mentioned … I’m hearing my name mentioned a little bit tonight. I wonder why and maybe, Pete mentions what the American people want. I will tell you, Pete, what the American people want and Joe what the American people want, they don’t want candidates to be running to billionaires for huge amounts of funding.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Let’s clear this up once and for all.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Pete has gotten funding [crosstalk 00:08:42] from 50 billionaires. Joe I think, has gotten a little bit more. What the American people want by the way, and a lot of the issues we’ll be discussing tonight are issues I raised four years ago. Raising the minimum wage to a living wage, 15 bucks an hour, making public colleges and universities tuition free and finally doing what every other major country on Earth does, guaranteeing healthcare to all people as a human right to a Medicare For All single payer system [crosstalk 00:00:09:14].

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: I can’t allow this to stand because it’s just not true. Senator Sanders has got people believing [crosstalk 00:09:21] something that is untrue about my campaign. The idea that most of my campaign is funded by billionaires-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: I didn’t say that, Pete.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: 50 people. All right, in Charleston alone, just in Charleston, over 2000 people have contributed to my campaign. That means the dollars that have come to my campaign just from Charleston is more than the dollars that have come from the 50 people that you mentioned. Grassroots contributions are the lifeblood of my campaign. In fact, I shouldn’t miss the opportunity. If you’re watching right now and you support my campaign, go to peteforamerica.com and chip in. And if you’re watching right now and you’re a billionaire, I will raise your taxes. But if you’d like to defeat Donald Trump, please go to peteforamerica.com and donate the legal maximum of $2,800 if you’re a billionaire.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: All right, Mayor Buttigieg. Vice President Biden, I want to bring us to another topic. We’re in South Carolina. It’s the first primary with a significant black voting population. Your numbers appear to be slipping with black voters and I’m wondering if you could respond about why that is happening to you at this particular time.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Well first of all, the latest poll, I saw my numbers, I’m still 15 points ahead. The latest poll.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Yes, yes, you’re correct.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: But look-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: But Senator Sanders is in striking distance of you. You are within the margin of error in this state.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Well, it depends on which … Look, I’ve earned the vote. I’ve worked like the devil to earn the vote of the African American community, not just here but across the country. I’ve been coming here for years and years creating jobs here, making sure that the port, for example, that employs one in 11 people, we put $500 million in our administration just into this county. We’ve created jobs for people. The people know me. My entire career has been wrapped up in dealing with civil rights and civil liberties. I don’t expect anything. I plan to earn the vote. I’m here to ask [inaudible 00:11:16]. But folks, I intend to win South Carolina and I will win the African American vote here in South Carolina.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Mr. Biden, will you continue if you do not win South Carolina. You have said that South Carolina will determine the outcome of this presidential race. If you don’t win South Carolina, will you continue?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: I will win South Carolina.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: All right, sir. Mayor Bloomberg, I’d like to bring you in this conversation. I want to ask you about a question that impacts the black and brown community. You’ve apologized for stop-and-frisk repeatedly. What exactly are you apologizing for?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: We let it get out of control. And when I realized that I cut it back by 95%. And I’ve apologized and asked for forgiveness, I’ve met with black leaders to try to get an understanding of-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: [inaudible 00:12:00] I’ve met with Black leaders to try to get an understanding of how I can better position myself and what I should have done and what I should do next time. But let me tell you, I have been working very hard. We’ve improved the school system for Black and Brown students in New York City. We’ve increased the jobs that are available to them. We’ve increased the housing that’s available to them. We have programs like the-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: But what more can you do about this issue, Mr. Mayor, to put people’s fears and skepticism to rest?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: I think they just-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: It continues to follow you.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: No. Well, that’s because it’s in their interest to promote that. But if you talk to the people in New York City, I have over 100 Black elected officials that have endorsed me. A lot of them are in the audience tonight. And I’ve earned the respect of people in New York City. I was the mayor of the largest, most populous city in the United States for 12 years, and people will tell you it’s a lot better city today. It is safer for everybody. The school system is better. The budget’s under control. We’ve done the things that people need in New York City for all ethnicities.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Mayor Buttigieg, mayor to mayor, you’ve certainly had your issues with the Black community as well. Do you think the New York City’s implementation of stop and frisk was racist?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Yes. In effect, it was. Because it was about profiling people based on their race. And the mayor even said that they disproportionately stopped White people too often and minorities too little. And I’m not here to score points. I come at this with a great deal of humility, because we have had a lot of issues, especially when it comes to racial justice and policing in my own community.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: And I come to this with some humility because I’m conscious of the fact that there are seven White people on this stage talking about racial justice. None of us have the experience, the lived experience of, for example, walking down the street or in a mall and feeling eyes on us, regarding us as dangerous, without knowing the first thing about us just because the color of our skin. None of us have the experience that Black women have had that drives that maternal mortality gap that we are all rightly horrified by, of going into a doctor and being less likely to have your description of being in pain believed because of your race.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you, Mayor.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Since we don’t have the experience, the next best thing-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you, Mayor.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: … we can do is actually listen to those who do.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you. I’m going to get to [crosstalk 00:14:27]-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Wait a second. I know that if I were Black, my success would have been a lot harder to achieve. And I know a lot of Black people that if they were White, it would’ve been a lot easier for them. That’s just a fact, and we’ve got to do something about it than rather just demagogue about it.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Klobuchar, was the way that the mayor implemented stop and frisk racist?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Yes, and I think that what we need to do instead of just reviewing everything from the past is talk about where we’re going to go forward. Martin Luther King once said that we are all tied in a single garment of destiny, and that what affects one of us directly affects all of us indirectly. So when there is racism in the criminal justice system, then we need to fix it. And to me that means sentencing reform, like the First Step Act, and extending that to the states with the Second Step Act.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: It means equal opportunity, because if we don’t pass Representative Clyburn’s bill out of South Carolina here to invest in impoverished communities, we’re never going to get to that single garment of destiny.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: And we also need to do something about child care, about making sure we increase the minimum wage. And then, finally, voting. While we are all sitting here debating, Wisconsin has kicked hundreds of thousands-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: … of people off of their voting rolls.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you, Senator.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Georgia kicked 100,000 off. As president-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: … I will get voting rights to be a reality for everyone.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you, Senator. Gayle?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Senator Warren, I’m coming to you. I want to direct this question to you because Mayor Bloomberg has said he got in this race late because he doesn’t believe that any of you on stage can beat Donald Trump. You said Mayor Bloomberg is not the safest candidate, he is the riskiest candidate. What did you mean by that?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: I mean that Mayor Bloomberg … Let’s think of it this way. We’re here in Charleston, and you know who’s going to be in Charleston later this week is Donald Trump. He’s going to be here to raise money for his buddy, Senator Lindsey Graham. Who funded Lindsey Graham’s campaign for re-election last time? It was Mayor Bloomberg.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: And that’s not the only right-wing senator that Mayor Bloomberg has funded. In 2016, he dumped $12 million into the Pennsylvania Senate race to help re-elect an anti-choice, right-wing Republican senator. And I just want to say, the woman challenger was terrific. She lost by a single point. In 2012, he scooped in to try to defend another Republican senator against a woman challenger. That was me. It didn’t work, but he tried hard.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: I don’t care how much money Mayor Bloomberg has. The core of the Democratic Party will never trust him. He has not earned their trust. I will. And the fact that he cannot earn the trust of core of the Democratic Party means he is the riskiest candidate standing on this stage.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: All right, Senator Warren, thank you. Mayor Bloomberg, would you like to respond? Mayor Bloomberg?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: I have been training for this job since I stepped on the pile that was still smoldering on 9/11. I know what to do. I’ve shown I know how to run a country. I’ve run the city which is almost the same size … is bigger than most countries in the world. I’m the one choice that makes some sense. I have the experience, I have the resources, and I have the record. And all those sideshows that the Senator wants to bring up have nothing to do with that. When people hired me to run New York City three times, in an overwhelmingly Democratic, progressive city, they elected me again and again.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Mr. Vice President?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: I was mentioned in this.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: No-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: I’d like to respond.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: There was a-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Go ahead, Senator.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: He called me out by name in this-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: There was a … I thought-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … and referred to what I talk about as a “sideshow.” This is personal for me. When I was 21 years old, I got my first job as a special education teacher. I loved that job. And by the end of the first year, I was visibly pregnant. The principal wished me luck and gave my job to someone else. Pregnancy discrimination? You bet. But I was 21 years old, I didn’t have a union to protect me, and I didn’t have any federal law on my side. So I packed up my stuff, and I went home. At least I didn’t have a boss who said to me, “Kill it,” the way that Mayor Bloomberg-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Never said that.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … is alleged to have said-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Oh, come one.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … to one of his pregnant employees. People want a chance-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: That-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: People want a chance-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you, Senator.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … to hear from the women who have worked for Mayor Bloomberg.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: I never said that.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: I want to allow the Mayor [crosstalk 00:19:25] to respond.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: And for the record, if she was a teacher in New York City, she would never have had that problem. We treated our teachers the right way, and the unions will tell you exactly that.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Well, Mayor Bloomberg, Senator Warren has raised-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Then let us have … the women have an opportunity to speak. The Bloomberg corporations and Mayor Bloomberg himself have been accused of discrimination. They are bound by nondisclosures so that they cannot speak. If he says there is nothing to hide here, then sign a blanket release, and let those women speak out-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Hey, no.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … so that they can tell their stories-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: [crosstalk 00:20:01].

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … the way I can tell my story without-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Norah?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you. I-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … having the fear-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Norah.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … that they’re going to be sued by a billionaire.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you. Thank you. We have a number of issues to discuss tonight, but I want to give the Mayor an opportunity to respond because she has raised concerns about women in your workplace. At the last debate, you said some of your female employees might not have liked some of your jokes. Did these women take your jokes wrong? Or were you wrong to make the jokes?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Probably wrong to make the jokes. I don’t remember what they were, so I assume if it bothered them, I was wrong, and I apologize. I’m sorry for that. But what happened here is we went back 40 years, and we could only find three cases where women said they were uncomfortable. Nobody accused me of doing anything other than just making a comment or two. And what the Senator did suggest was that we release these women from the nondisclosure agreement. I did that two days later, and my company has said we will not use nondisclosure agreements ever again. The Senator has got it, and I don’t know what else she wants us to do.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Oh, I’ll be clear.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: We’re following exactly what she asked to do.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: I’ll tell you exactly what I want you to do.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: And the trouble is with this Senator, enough is never enough for what this … I’m going to start focusing on some of these other things. We just cannot continue to re-litigate this every time. We did what she asked. And, thank you, we’ve probably made the world better because of it. And by my company renouncing using these, we probably changed, hopefully, the corporate landscape all across America.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: No, I’m sorry, Mr. Mayor-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: If you get nominated, we’ll be re-litigating this all year.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … you did not do what I asked.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Senator Warren, that is a very serious charge that you leveled at the Mayor.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Yes.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: He told a woman to get an abortion. What evidence do you have of that?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Her own words.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: And Mayor Bloomberg, could you respond to this?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: I-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: This is-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: … never said it. Period. End of story.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Look-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Categorically never said it. When I was accused of doing it, we couldn’t figure out what she was talking about. But right now, I’m sorry if she heard what she thought she heard or whatever happened. I didn’t take any pleasure in that. And we’ve just got to go on. But I never said it. Come on.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: All right.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: What I asked the Mayor to do is to do a release of all people who have discrimination claims-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: We are doing that, Senator.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Who have discrimination claims-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Norah. Norah.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: … against the Mayor.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: We want to get to the issue of electability and the ideological difference within the Democratic Party.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: Okay.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Good.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Sanders-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Thank you.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: … the cost of your agenda. Yesterday, you released information about how you will pay for your major proposals, but not all of your details are clear. You proposed more than $ 50 trillion in new spending. You’ve said Medicare for All-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Over a 10-year period.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: … will cost $30 trillion. But you can only explain how you’ll pay for just about half of that. Can you do the math for the rest of us?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: How many hours do you have?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Two.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: The answer is-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: That’s the problem.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: No, that’s not the problem. All right, let’s talk about Medicare for All. I’m sure you’re familiar with the new study that just came out of Yale University published in Lancet magazine, one of the prestigious medical journals in the world. You know what it said? Medicare for All will lower healthcare costs in this country by $450 billion a year and save 68,000 lives of people who otherwise would have died.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: What we need to do is to do what every other major country on Earth does: guarantee healthcare to all people, not have thousands of separate insurance plans, which are costing us some $500 billion a year to administer. Our plan, we have laid out options all over the place. One of the options is a seven-and-a-half-percent payroll tax on employers, which will save them substantial sums of money. Another tax-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Bernie, let me respond to this.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: We can do the math right now.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: You asked me a question.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Klobuchar, does the math add up?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: No, the math does not add up. In fact, just on 60 Minutes this weekend, he said he wasn’t going to rattle through the nickels and the dimes. Well, let me tell you how many nickels and dimes we’re …

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: The nickels and the dimes. Well, let me tell you how many nickels and dimes we’re talking about. Nearly $60 trillion. Do you know how much that is for all of his programs? That is three times the American economy. Not the federal government, the entire American economy. The Medicare for All plan alone, page eight clearly says that it will kick 149 million Americans off their current health insurance in four years. That is true. As one prominent Democrat once said, “We should pay attention to where the voters of this country are,” Bernie. That prominent Democrat was Barack Obama a few months ago. And I think that’s what we should do. They are not with you on spending nearly $60 trillion.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: First of all.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: What I think we should do is make things more affordable, nonprofit public option. Make sure we’re paying for longterm care better. Take on the pharmaceuticals like you and I have done together.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you Senator.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: And do something for the people of America.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you Senator Klobuchar.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: Instead of a bunch of broken promises that sound good on bumper stickers.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: I think that she’s talking about me.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Mr. Steyer, Mr. Steyer.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: I think we’re talking about math.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: We will get to you Mr. Sanders.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Let’s talk about it.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Let me, can I say something?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Look, first of all.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Wait a minute, let me go, let me go.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: I think. Tom, I think she was talking about my plan, not yours.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: I think we were talking about math. And it doesn’t take two hours to do the math. Because, let’s talk about what it adds up to.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Let’s talk about math!

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Let’s talk about math, indeed.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Let’s talk about math!

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Okay, so here’s the math.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Doing nothing is what … Excuse me, can I respond to the attack?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Doing nothing is what will happen-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Sanders, you are allowed a quick response.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Excuse me, I was called on.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Then we would like to allow the other candidates.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Nothing is what will happen if we put forward a candidate-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: The moderator guys.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Sanders? Senator Sanders?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: The moderator … Is it my turn?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Sanders, you have been name checked, you are allowed to respond.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Okay. What the Health and Human Services have said in analyzing healthcare costs, what recent Yale study has said, is that your program would cost some $50 trillion over a 10 year period. We would continue to pay, in some cases, 10 times more for the same exact prescription drugs. What every study out there, conservative or progressive says, Medicare for All will save money. Ours will cost about 45 billion, not 60 trillion. [crosstalk 00:26:22].

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Senator Sanders, we would like to bring Mr. Steyer in on this conversation. Mr. Steyer, please.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: I was talking about all your programs.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Excuse me, Amy. This conversation shows a huge risk for the Democratic Party. We are looking at a party that has decided that we’re either going to support someone who is a Democratic Socialist or somebody who has a long history of being a Republican. And let me say that I got into this race because I wanted to fight for economic justice, for racial justice, and to make sure we had climate justice for the American people. And I am scared. If we cannot pull this party together, if we go to one of those extremes, we take a terrible risk of reelecting Donald Trump.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you Mr. Steyer.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: And that is something … I still have some time. And let me just say this.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you Mr. Steyer.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: That is a risk that will hurt the American people in a way that none of us on this stage should be willing to risk.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you. Let’s keep this topic going, Mayor Pete.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: So let’s do some math. Senator Sanders at one point said it was going to be 40 trillion. Then it was 30. Then it was 17. It’s an incredible shrinking price tag. At some point has said it is unknowable to even see what the price tag would be. Now there are new numbers. I’ll tell you exactly what it adds up to. It adds up to four more years of Donald Trump, Kevin McCarthy is Speaker of the House, and the inability to get the Senate into Democratic hands. The time has come for us to stop acting like the presidency is the only office that matters. Not only is this a way to get Donald Trump reelected, we got a House to worry about. We got a Senate to worry about. And this really important.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Hello.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: If you want to keep the House in Democratic hands, you might want to check with the people who actually turned the House blue. 40 Democrats who are not running on your platform.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: They are running away from your platform as fast as they possibly can. I want to send those Democrats back to the United States House.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Time’s up Mr. Mayor. Vice President Biden.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: Let’s listen to them.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Vice President Biden, please.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Pete Buttigieg
speech: When they say that they don’t want to be out there defending Senator Sanders.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Vice President Biden, please.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: I guess the only way to do this is jump in and speak twice as long as you should. Here’s the deal. Here’s the deal, look. A guy is a friend of mine down there named Fritz Hollings, the pastor. He said, “You want to know what a man or woman will do? Look what they’ve done. Look what they’ve done.” You talk about concerns about race. Well, my good friend on the end of this platform, he in fact bought a system that was a private prison system. After he knew that in fact what happened was they hogtied young men in prison here in this state. They in fact made sure that in Georgia they did not have health care for the people who were being held. They in fact went on, and he said, after he knew that he bought it. And then he said he was proud of his accomplishment. You talk about what we’re talking about with Bernie. Bernie in fact, hasn’t passed much of anything. The fact of the matter is-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Okay, but I get to answer that. I get to answer that.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Look, the fact is-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: They’re out of time and I get to answer.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: I’m not out of time, you spoke overtime and I’m going to talk. Here’s the deal. Here’s the deal. The fact of the matter is, look at what’s happening here. Look at what’s happening here. We have to win the Senate back. And by the way, I went into all of those races that got 41 new Democrats. The majority of them are supporting me for president.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Mr. President, I have to allow. Yes, Mr. Mayor.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: Wait a second.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Mr. Mayor, you’re allowed to respond.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: I bought stock in a prison company thinking they’d do a better job and I investigated and I sold it.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: But you knew, you knew when you bought it they had done that.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: I get to answer this question. And in fact, since then I’ve worked to end the use of private prisons in my home state and we’ve ended it. I’ve started a bank to support black ownership of businesses, women ownership of businesses, and Latino owners of businesses. Because this financial service industry is prejudice. I have worked tirelessly on this and you know I’m right. You wrote the Crime Bill that you call-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Where we come from that’s called Tommy come lately.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: The Joe Biden Crime Bill, that put hundreds of thousands of young black and Latino men in prison.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Okay, let me say something.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: There’s something going on here.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you Mr. Steyer.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Tom Steyer
speech: I have worked for racial justice completely and that is an absolute unfair statement.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: All I know-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Tommy come lately.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: If we spend the next four months tearing our party apart, we’re going to watch Donald Trump spend the next four years tearing our country apart.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Joe Biden
speech: Look.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Amy Klobuchar
speech: So my argument here is that we need to get back to what’s happening right now. We have a clear choice of who’s going to lead this party. And I am the only one in the New Hampshire debate, when asked if we had a problem with a Socialist leading the ticket, that raise my hand. I like Bernie. We came in together to the Senate. But I do not think that this is the best person to lead the ticket. And if you want to talk about getting things done and come make a comparison. According to Vanderbilt University in Tennessee, last Congress, I was the most effective Democrat in the US Senate on 15 metrics. Bernie and Elizabeth were in the bottom half. It matters. It matters if you can actually get things done. It is not just who talks to the best, who actually gets things done. And especially with the African American community, there have been a lot of broken promises. And I think having someone that keeps their promises and follows through and is going to get things done for this people, matters. [crosstalk 00:07:53].

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: Mayor Bloomberg, please.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Let’s just go on the record. They talk about 40 Democrats. 21 of those were people that I spent $100 million to help elect. All of the new Democrats that came in and put Nancy Pelosi in charge and gave the Congress the ability to control this president, I got them. Number two, when you talk about money, let’s put this in perspective. The federal budget is four and a half trillion dollars a year. We get three and a half trillion dollars in revenue. We lose $1 trillion a year. That’s why the federal budget deficit is … Right now, the debt is $20 trillion going up to 21. We just cannot afford some of the stuff people talk about. But if you … Let me finish. If you keep on going, we will elect Bernie. Bernie will lose to Donald Trump. And Donald Trump and the House and the Senate and some of the State Houses will all go red. And then between gerrymandering and appointing judges, for the next 20 or 30 years, we’re going to live with this catastrophe.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Mayor Bloomberg, thank you. I will allow Senator Sanders a quick response and then Senator Warren.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Thank you very much, Norah.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator Sanders, a quick response and then Senator-

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Thank you very much. Mayor Bloomberg has a solid and strong and enthusiastic base of support. Problem is they’re all billionaires. If you look … On the other hand, of the last 50 polls that have been done nationally, Mr. Bloomberg, I beat Trump 47 of those 50 times. If you look at battleground States like Michigan, Wisconsin, and Pennsylvania, polling just done.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: The polls aren’t the election.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: I beat Trump. And if you want to be Trump, what you’re going to need is an unprecedented, grassroots movement of black and white and Latino, Native American and Asian people that was standing up and fighting for justice.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: That’s what our movement is about.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: Can anybody in the room imagine moderate Republicans going over and voting for him?

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Bernie Sanders
speech: Absolutely.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Michael Bloomberg
speech: And you have to that or you can’t win.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Thank you. Senator Warren.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: That is the problem. And that is that a progressive agenda is popular, Mayor Bloomberg. And for everyone on this stage, we talk about how to build a future. That’s what matters. I talk to people in selfie lines every day who tell me about the importance of getting real help on healthcare. It’s why I also have a way to pay for healthcare that doesn’t raise taxes on middle-class families. But it’s so much more than that. As Democrats, we need to speak to the future we can build together. We need to speak to the prosperity we can build together. How about a wealth tax in America? Because with a 2 cent tax on just the top one 10th of 1%, we have a chance to invest in universal childcare for every one of our babies. To really level the playing field. Put $50 billion into historically black colleges and universities. And start closing the racial wealth gap by canceling student loan debt for 43 million Americans. We need to talk about our aspirations, our hopes. This is a moment to choose hope over fear.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator, thank you.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Elizabeth Warren
speech: This is our moment.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 1: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Norah O’Donnell
speech: Senator, thank you. We have to take a quick break. When we come back, the Democratic Presidential Debate continues right after this. Only on CBS.

debate_name: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript: February 25 Democratic Debate
debate_section: Part 2: South Carolina Democratic Debate Transcript
speaker: Gayle King
speech: I’m Gayle King, with Norah O’Donnell. Joining us now on the questions here in Charleston, South Carolina are our CBS news colleagues, the A Team, Bill Whitaker of 60 Minutes, Chief Washington Correspondent, that’s Major Garrett, and Margaret Brennan, moderator of Face the Nation. We’re going to begin with you, Vice President Biden, for this part. Just across the street, as you mentioned at the top of the debate, is a theater where nine people were shot and killed inside the Mother Emanuel Church. We all remember that day back in 2015. And every day in our country, over 100 people die from gun violence.
